title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can subtract $$4$$ on both sides get $$\sqrt{6n+1}=4$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
speech: the square root of 6 n plus 1 end root, squared is equal to, 4 squared \nAfter squaring both sides, we get  6 n plus 1 is equal to 16 .
